thread.title: SAG Awards 2017: Michelle Williams brings Busy Phillips
thread.title_full: SAG Awards 2017: Michelle Williams brings Busy Phillips | Daily Mail Online

author: Chelsea White For Dailymail.com
title: SAG Awards 2017: Michelle Williams brings Busy Phillips
text:
Last time these two headed to a Hollywood awards show, things got a little messy thanks to a few too many champagnes.
Whether there will be a repeat of their Golden Globes big night out remains to be seen, but one thing is for sure Michelle Williams and Busy Philips are always setting the friendship goals bar high.
The 36-year-old Screen Actors Guild Award nominee walked down the Los Angeles red carpet hand-in-hand with gal pal Busy on Sunday night.
Scroll down for all the SAG Award winners
Friendship goals: Michelle Williams and Busy Philips attended the Screen Actors Guild Awards in Los Angeles, California, on Sunday night
The pair shone - literally - as they made their way into the awards with both opting to wear heavily sequinned outfits.
Michelle - who missed out on the Outstanding Performance by a Female Actor in a Supporting Role to Viola Davis - wore a embellished gown by Louis Vuitton.
The sleeveless V-neck dress featured gold, silver and black vertical stripes.
The gown clung closely to the Manchester By The Sea actress' figure but she was able to walk with ease as the dress had a split at the front and both sides.
Golden girls: The pair shone - literally - as they made their way into the awards with both opting to wear heavily sequinned outfits
Got her back: The 36-year-old Screen Actors Guild Award nominee walked down the red carpet hand-in-hand with gal pal Busy
Heavy metal: Michelle wore a embellished gown by Louis Vuitton that featured gold, silver and black vertical stripes
Earn your stripes like Michelle in an embellished dress by Louis Vuitton Louis Vuitton custom made dress
Shop the current dress collection here...
Buy now
If you're just catching up on all the glamour from last night's Screen Actors Guild Awards, then we're on hand to help with a round-up of red carpet trends.
The likes of Emily Blunt, Nicole Kidman and Ariel Winter all went for heavily embellished dresses, but the most dazzling dress of all was the Louis Vuitton number Michelle Williams wore.
As a brand ambassador, it's hardly surprising Michelle turned to Creative Director Nicolas Ghesquiere to design a dress for her red carpet appearance. We love the Studio 54-style gold and silver stripes, which elongate the figure and add a whole lot of glamour. The skinny scarf balances out the neckline perfectly, and when styled by Kate Young with jewellery by Louis Vuitton, Michelle looked flawless!
Unfortunately this custom made piece isn't up for grabs, but click (right) to get a bit of LV in your life. Or read between the lines in one of the striped dresses we've picked out for you in the edit below. From Lavish Alice to Milly, we've got all budgets covered.

Honour to be nominated: Michelle missed out on the Outstanding Performance by a Female Actor in a Supporting Role with Viola Davis taking home the award
Following the gown's straight lines, Michelle wore a gunmetal sequin scarf which was the same width as her stripes.
The scarf meant the actress did not need a necklace and she also avoided wearing earrings too with a ring her sole piece of jewellery.
Michelle wore the dress with a pair of black strappy heels which fastened around her ankles and had a lucite heel.
Like a glove: The gown clung closely to the Manchester By The Sea actress' figure but she was able to walk with ease as the dress had a split at the front and both sides
Straight and narrow: The scarf meant the actress did not need a necklace and she also avoided wearing earrings too with a ring her sole piece of jewellery
Added extras: Michelle wore the dress with a pair of black strappy heels which fastened around her ankles and had a lucite heel
Her date Busy also wore sequins opting for a three-quarter sleeve gown which highlighted her curves.
The 37-year-old's gown was a abstract blend of purple, silver, white and grey.
Busy accessorized her look with a small purple minaudiere despite the fact having a small bag last time caused her a lot of trouble.
Purple perfection: Her date Busy also wore sequins opting for a three-quarter sleeve gown which highlighted her curves
Brave choice: Busy accessorized her look with a small purple minaudiere despite the fact having a small bag last time caused her a lot of trouble
No repeats: At the Globes earlier this month, Busy decided to not bring keys with her as they did not fit in her bag. When she arrived home a little tipsy her husband had fallen asleep and she found herself locked out in the rain
When Busy and Michelle went to the Globes earlier this month, Busy decided to not bring keys with her as they did not fit in her bag.
When she arrived home a little tipsy her husband had fallen asleep and she found herself locked out in the rain.
On Sunday, Busy took to Instagram Stories to reassure fans there would not be a repeat as she had her keys on her this time.
Fancy seeing you here: Michelle caught up with fellow SAG nominee Thandie Newton on the red carpet
